text:
Debbie Reynolds & Carrie Fisher: Bright Lights on HBO By E. Mitchell   9:59 AM Film Hound had the privilege of meeting dynamic Debbie Reynolds backstage at the Drury Lane Theatre in Chicago many years ago. In her powerhouse performance, Ms. Reynolds spoke proudly of her … Bulldog Digs Music By E. Mitchell on October 4, 2016 at 7:59 AM Riddle: When is a dog not a dog? When he’s a hepcat! Some dogs dig bones, but this bulldog loves bopping to the beat of the blues. Doggone it, his buddy just can’t get into the groove. … Prairie Dog Olympics By E. Mitchell on May 17, 2016 at 9:27 AM Travel through time with the RiffTrax gang as they revisit the time-traveling flick TIME CHASERS, tonight at a theater near you! If you missed the RiffTrax Live event on May 5th, just set your … Ginger’s Pet Rescue Launches Adoption Truck By E. Mitchell on April 12, 2016 at 8:05 AM Embarking on the tenth year of saving death row dogs (over 9800 saved), Ginger’s Pet Rescue rolls on with a new mobile adoption truck, a great addition to the greater Puget Sound area. Ginger credits … Clarence, the Cross-Eyed Lion By E. Mitchell on March 31, 2016 at 8:32 AM To celebrate the changing of the guard from lion to lamb at the end of March, check out the 1965 comedy, Clarence, the Cross-Eyed Lion, starring Betsy Drake and Marshall Thompson. Cuddly Clarence … A Valentine from Bing Crosby & Fred Astaire By E. Mitchell on February 8, 2016 at 8:15 AM If it’s romance you’re looking for on Valentine’s Day, look no further than this clip from the classic holiday flick Holiday Inn, from 1942. The “Dream Factory” delivers all the hearts and flowers … Happy Birthday, Harpo Marx! By E. Mitchell on November 23, 2015 at 8:08 AM Groucho Marx may have immortalized “Lydia” as the Queen of Tattoos, but his brother Harpo had some interesting ink up his sleeve (literally!), worthy of the title “King of Tattoos” in a scene from … Archives Archives
